intro: Cyanus triumfettii subsp. strictus, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white to pale blue petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open fields and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a common and recognizable species in its native habitat.
